A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From apantao; a encounter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Air, the lower air we breathe. From aemi; 'air'.
And, even, also, namely.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

17.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
17.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

18.str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

18.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
18.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

18.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
18.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
